title: 109_s2759
content: The Act is titled the "Medicare Part D Outreach and Enrollment Enhancement Act of 2006". It includes provisions for outreach and education funding. The "Medicare Part D Outreach and Enrollment Enhancement Act of 2006" allocates $13.5 million for outreach and education by State Health Insurance Counseling Programs in fiscal year 2006. Additional funding is authorized for future outreach efforts based on the number of individuals enrolled in Medicare. During the fiscal year, funds are allocated for outreach and education related to enrollment in Medicare programs. $6,300,000 is appropriated for outreach and education on the Medicare prescription drug program. The Administrator of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services will transfer funds to the Administration on Aging for distribution to Area Agencies on Aging and Native American aging programs under an interagency agreement. Guidelines will be established for the distribution of funds based on population served. Timing for the interagency agreement and fund distribution is specified. The Administrator of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services will enter into an interagency agreement within 60 days of enactment, and the Administration on Aging will distribute funds within 120 days as per the agreement. SEC. 3. SPECIAL ENROLLMENT PERIOD FOR INDIVIDUALS ELIGIBLE FOR AN INCOME-RELATED SUBSIDY. Special Enrollment Period for low-income subsidy application under section 1860D-1(b)(3) of the Social Security Act. Applicable individual defined as a part D eligible individual with a pending income-related subsidy application during the initial enrollment period. The special enrollment period for low-income subsidy application is for individuals with pending income-related subsidy applications during their initial enrollment period. The special enrollment period lasts up to 30 days starting from the date the individual receives notification of the application's approval or disapproval. The amendment allows for a waiver of the late enrollment penalty for applicable individuals who enroll during the special enrollment period. The effective date of these changes is retroactive to the enactment of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003.
